author: Hadlee Simons
title: Vox uncapped bundle for R99/month
text:
Vox uncapped bundle for R99/month Article By: Hadlee Simons Thu, 01 Oct 2015 5:06 PM Share Credit: sxc.hu 
Vox Telecom has been on fire lately when it comes to ADSL offerings. 
The company delivered a bargain 100GB special earlier this year, setting users back R164 a month. 
Then the ISP offered a 300GB ADSL promotion for R485 a month - so what will the company offer next? 
Well, you're looking at an aggressively priced uncapped bundle for entry-level customers. 
For R89 a month you get a 1Mbps uncapped data-only account, but for R99 a month, the company will throw in ADSL line rental as well (you'll still need to pay for the analogue phone line rental). 
Otherwise, they've also introduced lower-priced uncapped data-only offerings. 
The 2Mbps uncapped account will set you back R169, the 4Mbps option will cost R289, the 8Mbps account costs R359 and the 10Mbps account has a R389 price tag. 
"This new line of products will be available to new and existing customers on a month-to-month subscription," the company said in a press statement. Read More
